content:
EnvelopedCms Class

Definition

The EnvelopedCms class represents a CMS/PKCS #7 structure for enveloped data.

In this Article

public sealed class EnvelopedCms
Inheritance
System.Object
EnvelopedCms

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()

Remarks

The Cryptographic Message Syntax RFC specifies the following MIME types and file name extensions for CMS/PKCS #7 messages with these content types.

Content type MIME type Extension
envelopedData application/pkcs7-mime .p7m
signedData application/pkcs7-signature .p7s.p7c

Constructors

EnvelopedCms()

The EnvelopedCms constructor creates an instance of the EnvelopedCms class.

public EnvelopedCms ();
Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

A null reference was passed to a method that does not accept it as a valid argument.

Remarks

The EnvelopedCms class has the following default property values.

Property Default value
ContentInfo 1.2.840.113549.1.7.1 (data)Length: zero
ContentEncryptionAlgorithm 1.2.840.113549.3.7 (RSA_DES_EDE3_CBC)

The default SubjectIdentifierType for recipients is SubjectIdentifierType.

EnvelopedCms(ContentInfo)

The EnvelopedCms constructor creates an instance of the EnvelopedCms class by using the specified content information as the inner content type.

public EnvelopedCms (System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.ContentInfo contentInfo);
contentInfo
ContentInfo

An instance of the stem.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.ContentInfo* class that represents the content and its type.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

A null reference was passed to a method that does not accept it as a valid argument.

Remarks

For the default property values used with this constructor, see EnvelopedCms().

EnvelopedCms(ContentInfo,AlgorithmIdentifier)

The EnvelopedCms constructor creates an instance of the EnvelopedCms class by using the specified content information and encryption algorithm. The specified content information is to be used as the inner content type.

public EnvelopedCms (System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.ContentInfo contentInfo, System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.AlgorithmIdentifier encryptionAlgorithm);
contentInfo
ContentInfo

A ContentInfo object that represents the content and its type.

encryptionAlgorithm
AlgorithmIdentifier

An AlgorithmIdentifier object that specifies the encryption algorithm.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

A null reference was passed to a method that does not accept it as a valid argument.

Remarks

For the default property values used with this constructor, see EnvelopedCms().

EnvelopedCms(SubjectIdentifierType,ContentInfo)

The EnvelopedCms constructor creates an instance of the EnvelopedCms class by using the specified subject identifier type and content information. The specified content information is to be used as the inner content type.

public EnvelopedCms (System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifierType recipientIdentifierType, System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.ContentInfo contentInfo);
recipientIdentifierType
SubjectIdentifierType

A member of the SubjectIdentifierType enumeration that specifies the means of identifying the recipient.

contentInfo
ContentInfo

A ContentInfo object that represents the content and its type.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

A null reference was passed to a method that does not accept it as a valid argument.

Remarks

For the default property values used with this constructor, see EnvelopedCms().

Subjects can be identified by either the issuer and serial number of their public key certificate or by the key identifier of their public key certificate.

EnvelopedCms(SubjectIdentifierType,ContentInfo,AlgorithmIdentifier)

The EnvelopedCms constructor creates an instance of the EnvelopedCms class by using the specified subject identifier type, content information, and encryption algorithm. The specified content information is to be used as the inner content type.

public EnvelopedCms (System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifierType recipientIdentifierType, System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.ContentInfo contentInfo, System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.AlgorithmIdentifier encryptionAlgorithm);
recipientIdentifierType
SubjectIdentifierType

A member of the SubjectIdentifierType enumeration that specifies the means of identifying the recipient.

contentInfo
ContentInfo

A ContentInfo object that represents the content and its type.

encryptionAlgorithm
AlgorithmIdentifier

An AlgorithmIdentifier object that specifies the encryption algorithm.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

A null reference was passed to a method that does not accept it as a valid argument.

Properties

Certificates

The Certificates property retrieves the set of certificates associated with the enveloped CMS/PKCS #7 message.

public System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection Certificates { get; }
Value
X509Certificate2Collection

An X509Certificate2Collection collection that represents the X.509 certificates used with the enveloped CMS/PKCS #7 message. If no certificates exist, the property value is an empty collection.

ContentEncryptionAlgorithm

The ContentEncryptionAlgorithm property retrieves the identifier of the algorithm used to encrypt the content.

public System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.AlgorithmIdentifier ContentEncryptionAlgorithm { get; }
Value
AlgorithmIdentifier

An AlgorithmIdentifier object that represents the algorithm identifier.

Remarks

If an algorithm identifier was not set in a constructor, this property contains the default value. For the default property values used with the EnvelopedCms class, see EnvelopedCms().

ContentInfo

The ContentInfo property retrieves the inner content information for the enveloped CMS/PKCS #7 message.

public System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.ContentInfo ContentInfo { get; }
Value
ContentInfo

A ContentInfo object that represents the inner content information from the enveloped CMS/PKCS #7 message.

Remarks

If you call any of the decrypt methods, such as Decrypt(), before viewing this property, the content returned is encrypted.

RecipientInfos

The RecipientInfos property retrieves the recipient information associated with the enveloped CMS/PKCS #7 message.

public System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.RecipientInfoCollection RecipientInfos { get; }
Value
RecipientInfoCollection

A RecipientInfoCollection collection that represents the recipient information. If no recipients exist, the property value is an empty collection.

Remarks

Although this property is read-only, a modification to the RecipientInfo objects in the RecipientInfoCollection can be done by using their properties.

The RecipientInfos property is not populated as a result of calling the Encode method nor any of the overloaded EnvelopedCms.Encrypt methods.

UnprotectedAttributes

The UnprotectedAttributes property retrieves the unprotected (unencrypted) attributes associated with the enveloped CMS/PKCS #7 message. Unprotected attributes are not encrypted, and so do not have data confidentiality within an EnvelopedCms object.

public System.Security.Cryptography.CryptographicAttributeObjectCollection UnprotectedAttributes { get; }
Value
CryptographicAttributeObjectCollection

A CryptographicAttributeObjectCollection collection that represents the unprotected attributes. If no unprotected attributes exist, the property value is an empty collection.

Version

The Version property retrieves the version of the enveloped CMS/PKCS #7 message.

public int Version { get; }
Value
Int32

An int value that represents the version of the enveloped CMS/PKCS #7 message.

Remarks

The version determines whether the message is a PKCS #7 message or a Cryptographic Message Syntax (CMS) message. CMS is a newer superset of PKCS #7.

Methods

Decode(Byte[])

The Decode method decodes the specified enveloped CMS/PKCS #7 message and resets all member variables in the EnvelopedCms object.

public void Decode (byte[] encodedMessage);
encodedMessage
Byte[]

An array of byte values that represent the information to be decoded.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

A null reference was passed to a method that does not accept it as a valid argument.

Remarks

This method should be called before System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.Decrypt() or any other EnvelopedCms.Decrypt method.

Decrypt()

The Decrypt method decrypts the contents of the decoded enveloped CMS/PKCS #7 message. The Decrypt method searches the current user and computer My stores for the appropriate certificate and private key.

public void Decrypt ();
Exceptions
CryptographicException

A cryptographic operation could not be completed.

InvalidOperationException

A method call was invalid for the object's current state.

Remarks

Decode should be called before Decrypt or any other Decrypt method.

The Decrypt method does not search the computer My store if it is inaccessible.

.NET Framework Security

The following permissions are required to access the decryption key:

  • System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionFlags
  • System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionFlags

Decrypt(RecipientInfo)

The Decrypt method decrypts the contents of the decoded enveloped CMS/PKCS #7 message by using the private key associated with the certificate identified by the specified recipient information.

public void Decrypt (System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.RecipientInfo recipientInfo);
recipientInfo
RecipientInfo

A RecipientInfo object that represents the recipient information that identifies the certificate associated with the private key to use for the decryption.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

A null reference was passed to a method that does not accept it as a valid argument.

CryptographicException

A cryptographic operation could not be completed.

InvalidOperationException

A method call was invalid for the object's current state.

Remarks

.NET Framework Security

The following permissions are required to access the decryption key:

  • System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionFlags
  • System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionFlags

Decrypt(X509Certificate2Collection)

The Decrypt method decrypts the contents of the decoded enveloped CMS/PKCS #7 message by using the specified certificate collection. The Decrypt method searches the specified certificate collection and the My certificate store for the proper certificate to use for the decryption.

public void Decrypt (System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection extraStore);
extraStore
X509Certificate2Collection

An X509Certificate2Collection collection that represents additional certificates to use for the decryption. The Decrypt method searches this certificate collection and the My certificate store for the proper certificate to use for the decryption.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

A null reference was passed to a method that does not accept it as a valid argument.

CryptographicException

A cryptographic operation could not be completed.

InvalidOperationException

A method call was invalid for the object's current state.

Remarks

.NET Framework Security

The following permissions are required to access the decryption key:

  • System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionFlags
  • System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionFlags

Decrypt(RecipientInfo,X509Certificate2Collection)

The Decrypt method decrypts the contents of the decoded enveloped CMS/PKCS #7 message by using the private key associated with the certificate identified by the specified recipient information and by using the specified certificate collection. The Decrypt method searches the specified certificate collection and the My certificate store for the proper certificate to use for the decryption.

public void Decrypt (System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.RecipientInfo recipientInfo, System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection extraStore);
recipientInfo
RecipientInfo

A RecipientInfo object that represents the recipient information to use for the decryption.

extraStore
X509Certificate2Collection

An X509Certificate2Collection collection that represents additional certificates to use for the decryption. The Decrypt method searches this certificate collection and the My certificate store for the proper certificate to use for the decryption.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

A null reference was passed to a method that does not accept it as a valid argument.

CryptographicException

A cryptographic operation could not be completed.

InvalidOperationException

A method call was invalid for the object's current state.

Remarks

.NET Framework Security

The following permissions are required to access the decryption key:

  • System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionFlags
  • System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionFlags

Encode()

The Encode method encodes the contents of the enveloped CMS/PKCS #7 message and returns it as an array of byte values. Encryption must be done before encoding.

public byte[] Encode ();
Returns
Byte[]

If the method succeeds, the method returns an array of byte values that represent the encoded information.

If the method fails, it throws an exception.

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

A method call was invalid for the object's current state.

Remarks

System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.Encrypt() or another Encrypt method must be called before this method.

The Encode method does not cause the RecipientInfos property to be populated.

Encrypt()

The Encrypt method encrypts the contents of the CMS/PKCS #7 message.

public void Encrypt ();
Exceptions
CryptographicException

A cryptographic operation could not be completed.

Remarks

This method displays a user interface in which you choose the recipients for whom to encrypt the message. This requires that the current process is running in user interactive mode, meaning that the UserInteractive property is set to true. A process is normally in user interactive mode unless it is a service process or running inside a Web application.

The user interface will only present certificates that are within their validity period and that have key encipherment or key agreement included in their key usage.

The Encrypt method does not cause the RecipientInfos property to be populated.

.NET Framework Security

The following permissions are required to display the user interface:

  • System.Security.Permissions.UIPermissionWindow

Encrypt(CmsRecipient)

The Encrypt method encrypts the contents of the CMS/PKCS #7 message by using the specified recipient information.

public void Encrypt (System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.CmsRecipient recipient);
recipient
CmsRecipient

A CmsRecipient object that represents the recipient information.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

A null reference was passed to a method that does not accept it as a valid argument.

CryptographicException

A cryptographic operation could not be completed.

Remarks

The Encrypt method does not cause the RecipientInfos property to be populated.

Encrypt(CmsRecipientCollection)

The Encrypt method encrypts the contents of the CMS/PKCS #7 message by using the information for the specified list of recipients. The message is encrypted by using a message encryption key with a symmetric encryption algorithm such as triple DES. The message encryption key is then encrypted with the public key of each recipient.

public void Encrypt (System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.CmsRecipientCollection recipients);
recipients
CmsRecipientCollection

A CmsRecipientCollection collection that represents the information for the list of recipients.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

A null reference was passed to a method that does not accept it as a valid argument.

CryptographicException

A cryptographic operation could not be completed.

Remarks

The Encrypt method does not cause the RecipientInfos property to be populated.
